Polymarket, Circle ร่วมมือในการเปลี่ยนไปใช้การชำระเงิน native USDC

Polymarket, Circle partner in shift to native USDC settlement

1d ago//Cointelegraph by Nate Kostar
altcoins
AI

Summary

TH

Polymarket ได้จับมือกับ Circle เพื่อเปลี่ยนโครงสร้างพื้นฐานการชำระเงินจาก bridged USDC (USDC.e) บน Polygon ไปเป็น native USDC การเปลี่ยนแปลงนี้มีเป้าหมายเพื่อเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพทางการเงินและความปลอดภัยโดยลดการพึ่งพา cross-chain bridges ซึ่งช่วยให้มีมาตรฐานการชำระเงินเป็นดอลลาร์ที่มีประสิทธิภาพและเชื่อถือได้มากขึ้น Shayne Coplan ซีอีโอของ Polymarket ระบุว่าการเปลี่ยนนี้จะช่วยสนับสนุนความสมบูรณ์ของตลาดเนื่องจากจำนวนผู้ใช้งานในแพลตฟอร์มที่เพิ่มขึ้น การประกาศดังกล่าวเกิดขึ้นในช่วงที่ตลาดพยากรณ์ผล (prediction market) กำลังเติบโต โดยเว็บเทรด crypto รายใหญ่อย่าง Gemini, Coinbase และ Crypto.com ต่างเปิดตัวแพลตฟอร์มของตัวเอง แม้จะมีความสนใจและการนำไปใช้ที่เพิ่มขึ้นในช่วงการเลือกตั้งสหรัฐปี 2024 แต่อุตสาหกรรมนี้ยังเผชิญกับความท้าทาย นักวิเคราะห์ได้แสดงความกังวลเรื่อง insider trading และผู้ให้บริการอย่าง Kalshi ก็กำลังเผชิญกับการตรวจสอบจากผู้กำกับดูแลว่าสัญญาเหตุการณ์ต่างๆ ถือเป็นการพนันหรือไม่ในหลายรัฐของสหรัฐ

EN

Polymarket has partnered with Circle to transition its settlement infrastructure from bridged USDC (USDC.e) on Polygon to native USDC. This move aims to enhance capital efficiency and security by eliminating reliance on cross-chain bridges, offering a more scalable and reliable dollar-denominated standard for users. CEO Shayne Coplan emphasized that this shift supports market integrity as platform participation continues to grow. The announcement comes amid a broader boom in the prediction market sector, with major crypto exchanges like Gemini, Coinbase, and Crypto.com recently launching their own platforms. Despite this increased interest and adoption during the 2024 US election cycle, the industry faces challenges. Analysts have raised concerns about potential insider trading, and operators like Kalshi are encountering regulatory scrutiny regarding whether event contracts constitute gambling in various US states.

Key Points

  • Polymarket partners with Circle to migrate from bridged USDC.e to native USDC on Polygon.
  • Native USDC eliminates cross-chain bridge risks, offering better security and capital efficiency.
  • Major exchanges like Gemini, Coinbase, and Crypto.com are entering the prediction market space.
  • The sector faces ongoing challenges regarding insider trading risks and regulatory scrutiny in US states.

Article

Circle Internet Group has partnered with Polymarket to transition the prediction market’s settlement infrastructure to native USDC, replacing bridged stablecoin collateral used for trading on its platform. According to Thursday’s announcement , Polymarket currently uses bridged USDC (USDC.e) on Polygon as trading collateral and plans to migrate to Circle-issued native USDC ( USDC ) over the next few months. Native USDC is issued by Circle’s regulated entities and can be redeemed one-for-one for US dollars, offering a “capital-efficient” and scalable alternative without relying on cross-chain bridges. Cross-chain bridges are protocols that transfer tokens between blockchains by locking assets on one network and issuing corresponding representations on another. However, secure cross-chain communication introduces trade-offs in security, trust or flexibility that are not present on a single blockchain. The shift will move Polymarket’s collateral to a stablecoin issued and redeemed directly by Circle, rather than a bridged representation. Shayne Coplan, founder and CEO of Polymarket, said using USDC will support “a consistent, dollar-denominated settlement standard that enhances market integrity and reliability as participation on the platform continues to grow.” Event contracts on Polymarket. Source: Polymarket Polymarket is an onchain prediction market where users trade contracts tied to the outcomes of real-world events using stablecoins as collateral, including markets on cryptocurrency prices, political outcomes and other events. USDC is currently the second-largest stablecoin behind Tether’s USDt ( USDT ), with a market capitalization of about $70.77 billion, according to Defillama data . Related: Polymarket, Kalshi clash over groceries as prediction markets boom Crypto exchanges push deeper into prediction markets While Polymarket and Kalshi remain the leading prediction market platforms , several major crypto exchanges have recently entered the space. In mid-December, Gemini launched its in-house prediction market , Gemini Predictions, making event-based trading available across all 50 US states following regulatory approval, while Coinbase announced a prediction market in partnership with Kalshi a day later. Prediction market protocols. Source: Defillama On Tuesday, Crypto.com launched its prediction markets business as a standalone platform, OG, operated by Crypto.com Derivatives North America and available only to US users. Retail brokerage Robinhood and sports betting platform DraftKings also rolled out prediction markets in 2025, further crowding a category that first gained significant momentum during the 2024 US presidential election . Despite the growing popularity of prediction markets, some analysts have raised concerns that they may be vulnerable to insider trading , citing instances in which traders appeared to profit from nonpublic information or by influencing data used to set market prices. US states have also raised challenges, with Kalshi facing legal scrutiny from gaming regulators in Massachusetts , New York and several other states over whether its event contracts constitute gambling.
